<!-- Area/postal codes & others --> |postal_code_type = [[ZIP code]]s |postal_code = 55042, 55128 |area_code = [[Area code 651|651]] |blank_name = [[Federal Information Processing Standard|FIPS code]] |blank_info = 27-47680{{GR|2}} |blank1_name = [[Geographic Names Information System|GNIS]] feature ID |blank1_info = 0654516{{GR|3}} |website = [http://www.ci.oakdale.mn.us/ www.ci.oakdale.mn.us] |footnotes = }} '''Oakdale''' is a city in [[Washington County, Minnesota|Washington County]], [[Minnesota]], [[United States]], is a suburb of Saint Paul and is on the eastern side of the Twin Cities Metropolitan area. The population was 27,378 at the [[United States Census, 2010|2010 census]].<ref name="2010 Census" /> Oakdale is the 32nd largest city in Minnesota, in terms of population.
The city of Oakdale today is the result of a consolidation of Oakdale and Northdale Townships in the 1970s, and continued to annex land well into the 1990s.
Oakdale lies entirely within the North St. Paul-Maplewood-Oakdale school district, but the city's students are split into two high schools. [[Tartan Senior High School|Tartan]] High School is located within the city's boundaries, and serves the southern half of Oakdale. The city's northern residents are served by [[North High School (North St. Paul, Minnesota)|North]] High School in [[North St. Paul, Minnesota|North St. Paul]].
[[Imation]] World Headquarters is located in Oakdale. Nearby [[3M]] Headquarters employs many residents of the city.
Oakdale, Minnesota is currently the most populous of all municipalities that share the name 'Oakdale' in the United States.
==Geography== According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the city has a total area of {{convert|11.3|sqmi|km2}}, of which, {{convert|11.1|sqmi|km2}} of it is land and {{convert|0.2|sqmi|km2}} of it (1.86%)is water. Interstates [[Interstate 94|94]] and [[Interstate 694|694]] and Minnesota State Highways [[Minnesota State Highway 5|5]], [[Minnesota State Highway 36|36]], and [[Minnesota State Highway 120|120]] are five of the main routes in the community.
==Demographics== {{USCensusPop |1970= 7795 |1980= 12123 |1990= 18374 |2000= 26653 |2010= 27378 |footnote=<center>[http://www.census.gov/prod/www/abs/decennial/ U.S. Decennial Census]</center> }}
As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 26,653 people, 10,243 households, and 7,129 families residing in the city. The [[population density]] was 2,408.4 people per square mile (929.6/kmÂ²). There were 10,394 housing units at an average density of 939.2 per square mile (362.5/kmÂ²). The racial makeup of the city was 92.21% [[White (U.S. Census)|White]], 2.29% [[African American (U.S. Census)|African American]], 0.36% [[Native American (U.S. Census)|Native American]], 2.45% [[Asian (U.S. Census)|Asian]], 0.01% [[Pacific Islander (U.S. Census)|Pacific Islander]], 0.77% from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 1.91% from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Latino (U.S. Census)|Latino]] of any race were 2.75% of the population.
There were 10,243 households out of which 38.5% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 55.2% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 11.1% had a female householder with no husband present, and 30.4% were non-families. 25.2% of all households were made up of individuals and 7.2% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.59 and the average family size was 3.14.
In the city the population was spread out with 29.0% under the age of 18, 7.2% from 18 to 24, 34.6% from 25 to 44, 20.7% from 45 to 64, and 8.4% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 34 years. For every 100 females there were 93.1 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 87.0 males.
The median income for a household in the city was $56,299, and the median income for a family was $66,680. Males had a median income of $42,371 versus $32,343 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the city was $24,107. About 2.9% of families and 3.6% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 4.1% of those under age 18 and 3.9% of those age 65 or over.
Population projections put Oakdale's population at 30,000 by the year 2030.
